intro: Epilobium rhynchospermum, commonly known as the narrowleaf willow-herb, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are small, pinkish, and arranged in clusters. Epilobium rhynchospermum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
